events: The Intercollegiate Athletic Association of the United States (IAAUS) was established on March 31, 1906 and would later be known as the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA).
College Football under the IAAUS began as one division.
Iowa helps form the new Missouri Valley Intercollegiate Athletic Association, while retaining its existing membership in the Western Conference.
College football experiences its first subdivision. 140 larger schools now begin play in the "University Division", while the other 370 smaller schools begin play in the "College Division".
College football experiences further subdivision. The "University Division" is renamed to "Division I", while the "College Division" is subdivided into "Division II", and "Division III".

In January 1978, prior to the 1978 college football season, college football experiences another subdivision and was at the time the last subdivision to occur within NCAA college football. Division I is further subdivided into 'Division I-A,' considered the upper tier of Division I, and 'Division I-AA,' considered the lower tier of Division I.
Prior to the 2006 season Division I-A is renamed to the "Football Bowl Subdivision" and Division I-AA is renamed to the "Football Championship Subdivision".
